thread_replies.text: I can do a quick BC later
but the CVR uplift would be essentially most of our empty activation rate

and also depends if we're able to still let customers add addons post-checkout (which can be charged later)

if the condition for charge at checkout is that we cannot let people add addons then there will be a negative AOV impact to consider
of course, although... not sure if the impact is gonna be that prinounced, it's a separate payment flow for add-ons anyway, if we can simply maintain that one
Besides the empty conversion rate, please consider also CAC improvement, as we wont be paying Native partners for these empties.

messages.text: I'm looking to understand how preference migrations were done for brands previously. Anyone know which EM that worked with Claire/Kat back then would know about this?
messages.raw_text: I'm looking to understand how preference migrations were done for brands previously. Anyone know which EM that worked with Claire/Kat back then would know about this?

thread_replies.text: @U03TY4YJU4X / @U03R6F2AG9K
hey hey, hm... preference migrations, didn't we do this this year on TPT @U03UMPD2NNS?

Hey, we are planning to do it, we havent picked it up, as we needed more confidence that meal selections are reliable and robust.

Context: we used to use preferences for meal selection (preference would define which recipes you receive) and as part of the "Deprecating preferences" we started relying on recipe selection only. In case something backfired, we needed to have the preferences as our backup.

As far as I know we will own this migration internally.

just to make sure we're talking about the same thing -- you also set up your preferences on CCM right? So eg in the screenshot `keto` preferences will order the recipes according to the sequence of the numbers

"Deprecating preferences" so it means you'd actually move away from the logic above?

I'm trying to understand not how to deprecate preferences but how to move people from one preference to another

Eg if customers were previously on `keto` , how it works to migrate them to another preference such as `caloriesmart` if we choose to deprecate `keto`

The goal of this initiative was to not determine meals based on preferences.

We havent completed the migrations, but we will move users from preferences such as dry-chickenXdry-beef to one default preference for all plans and all recipes.

Every user will still have a preference, but we will not be using this data anywhere.

Overall, my recommendation will be to take these changes gradually, and not remove completely a preference, because if sth backfires, there wont be a way to revert it.

So maybe first you can migrate the users to calorie smart, monitor for a couple of weeks and only then fully deprecate them (if required)

@U1GA9435H might be a valid POC I vaguely remember her doing something in the past but @U01AKGWGLC8 what are you trying to migrate specifically? I'm sure we can work out a simple script to actually do the migration itself, but the only thing to watch out for potentially is whether future manual selections are persisted after this change. Might not be relevant in GoC if you aren't seeing multiple future weeks
@U03R6F2AG9K ill explain in our catchup

messages.text:
:alert2: Hey folks. I would like your comments on this by EOW :alert2:

1. *Problem*: with GenAI being proliferated through the organization and analyzing it's capabilities, the role of the product manager, their daily work is expected to shift and adapt. Product managers across HelloTech lack a definition of their new role, processes and ways to practically apply GenAI and its' capabilities in their daily/core work.
2. *Goal*: provide a new ways of working for product managers within the organization, based on what is available right now, offering a platform to build into the future to accelerate customer problem identificaiton, resolution and achieve business objectives.
3. *Approach*:
    a. Documented known use cases and flows, attempting to be tool agnostic where possible, avoid investment into tools that are "wrappers" on core models as much as possible
    b. Define new role and core tasks for a product manager within a GenAI augmented organization
    c. Provide tools and workflows that would support problem identification, prioritization, solutioning, execution and launch of software products with their teams
4. *Ask*: Feel free to review and comment the "Cheat Sheet" and experiment with the NotebookLM based on captured sources
    a. Feel free to go through the full source document
5. *Resources*:
    a. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kui7j2A6Ry2s1RbzRqBTWmH3GUWw5Ba3cLlOLAQO60Q/edit?usp=sharing (cheat sheet)
    b. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OM-lmUzYlIijXk5F2_WwkoY4n0BHVoN733m8V_aO0Ew/edit?usp=sharing
    c. https://notebooklm.google.com/notebook/f18e8213-e69b-41fd-999d-5036b8bb85a0
6. *Next* *steps*: work together with the AI Assemble and the UX/Engineering efforts on GenAI integration to augment and adapt the role and proposed approaches based on evolving capabilities.

1. *Problem*: with GenAI being proliferated through the organization and analyzing it's capabilities, the role of the product manager, their daily work is expected to shift and adapt. Product managers across HelloTech lack a definition of their new role, processes and ways to practically apply GenAI and its' capabilities in their daily/core work.
2. *Goal*: provide a new ways of working for product managers within the organization, based on what is available right now, offering a platform to build into the future to accelerate customer problem identificaiton, resolution and achieve business objectives.
3. *Approach*:
    a. Documented known use cases and flows, attempting to be tool agnostic where possible, avoid investment into tools that are "wrappers" on core models as much as possible
    b. Define new role and core tasks for a product manager within a GenAI augmented organization

    c. <https://notebooklm.google.com/notebook/f18e8213-e69b-41fd-999d-5036b8bb85a0|Notebook>
